description: Single storey front extension incorporating porch; single and two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; external alterations; outbuilding at rear for leisure use (demolition of attached garage)
decision_conditions: The proposed two-storey side to rear extension, by reason of its excessive depth and height along the neighbouring boundary with the western neighbour,&nbsp; and owing to the proposed side roof eaves overhanging the western boundary line, forms an incongruous form of development which is out of character for the surrounding area and harms the future development potential of No.&nbsp; 22 Weighton Road. Therefore, the proposal is contrary to Paragraphs 131 and 135 National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policy CS1 of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management&nbsp;(2013) and the Harrow Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).&nbsp;

<p>The applicant has failed to submit an adequate Flood Risk Assessment and has therefore failed to demonstrate that the proposed development would not exacerbate the risk of flooding within the site or increase the risk and consequences of flooding elsewhere, contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policies SI12 and SI13 of The London Plan (2021), Policy CS1 of Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and policies DM9 and DM10 of the Harrow Development Management Polices Local Plan (2013).</p>
